title.value: FusionRetro: Molecule Representation Fusion via In-Context Learning for Retrosynthetic Planning
title.justification: This is the title of the research paper provided.
title.quote: FusionRetro: Molecule Representation Fusion via In-Context Learning for Retrosynthetic Planning

extractions.description: This paper introduces FusionRetro, a novel framework designed to utilize contextual information for retrosynthetic planning. By encoding molecules, aggregating information over reaction routes, and predicting reactants using an in-context learning approach, the model aims to improve the efficiency and accuracy of retrosynthetic predictions. The framework was benchmarked on a newly curated dataset, showcasing significant performance improvements over existing methods.

type.justification: The paper focuses on the empirical evaluation of the FusionRetro model using experiments and benchmarks. It provides detailed comparisons and performance metrics to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach.
type.quote: Comprehensive experiments demonstrate that by fusing in the context information over routes, our model significantly improves the performance of retrosynthetic planning over baselines that are not context-aware, especially for long synthetic routes.

name.justification: The primary focus of the research is on retrosynthetic planning, which is a significant subfield of chemoinformatics within computational chemistry.
name.quote: Retrosynthetic planning aims to devise a complete multi-step synthetic route from starting materials to a target molecule.

name.justification: The specific problem addressed in this paper is retrosynthetic planning, which involves devising synthetic routes to achieve target molecules.
name.quote: Retrosynthetic planning aims to devise a complete multi-step synthetic route from starting materials to a target molecule.

name.justification: The paper applies machine learning techniques, particularly in-context learning, to improve retrosynthetic predictions.
name.quote: In this work, we propose a novel framework that utilizes context information for improved retrosynthetic planning.

name.justification: This is the primary model introduced and evaluated in the research paper.
name.quote: We propose a novel and principled context-aware model by fusing in the context embeddings, named FusionRetro, which is the first attempt to exploit in-context learning (Min et al., 2022) for retrosynthesis prediction in retrosynthetic planning.

is_contributed.justification: The model FusionRetro is a significant contribution of this paper, aimed at improving retrosynthetic planning by using contextual information.
is_contributed.quote: We propose a novel and principled context-aware model by fusing in the context embeddings, named FusionRetro, which is the first attempt to exploit in-context learning (Min et al., 2022) for retrosynthesis prediction in retrosynthetic planning.

is_executed.justification: The experiments were conducted using GPU resources, which is typical for deep learning models, although the specific hardware details are not provided.
is_executed.quote: Our proposed model, FusionRetro, is trained using 2 NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPUs.

is_compared.justification: The performance of FusionRetro was compared against several baseline models in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: Extensive experimental results demonstrate that our proposed module can enhance the performance of the baseline model noticeably, providing insightful guidance for future research in this direction.

referenced_paper_title.value: MetaICL: Learning to learn in context
referenced_paper_title.justification: The concept of in-context learning, which is foundational to the FusionRetro framework, is referenced from the paper titled 'MetaICL: Learning to learn in context.'
referenced_paper_title.quote: Our fusion leverages in-context learning to maximize the use of in-context reactions. Importantly, it is not limited to GNNs alone and can incorporate various aggregation methodologies, such as Transformer (Vaswani et al., 2017) and Graph Transformer (Ying et al., 2021).

name.justification: The dataset used for evaluating the retrosynthetic models is sourced from the public USPTO dataset.
name.quote: We construct a new benchmark with 58,099 synthetic routes retrieved from the public USPTO dataset for evaluation, in which we study the performance of multiple single-step retrosynthesis models in the context of multi-step planning.

referenced_paper_title.value: AizynthFinder: A fast, robust and flexible open-source software for retrosynthetic planning
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference paper for the USPTO dataset provides context and validation for its use in retrosynthetic planning tasks.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Following AiZynthFinder (Genheden et al., 2020), we define the starting materials as a set of commercially purchasable molecules, denoted as S âŠ† M.

name.justification: PyTorch is the deep learning library used for implementing the FusionRetro framework.
name.quote: We use Pytorch (Paszke et al., 2019) to implement FusionRetro.

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper describes the PyTorch library, which is a key component in implementing the FusionRetro model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The software that we use for experiments are Python 3.6.8, pytorch 1.9.0, pytorch-scatter 2.0.9, pytorch-sparse 0.6.12, numpy 1.19.2, torchvision 0.10.0, CUDA 10.2.89, CUDNN 7.6.5, einops 0.4.1, and torchdrug 0.1.3.
